Posts.Content: Ok, what is it and what does it do. I have seen it posted a few times and know its some form of treatment. Can anyone tell me a little more? Janet
Posts.Signature: Husband 46 Diagnosed 8-10-15 12 samples, all malignant Stage 4 Lymph Node involvement Peritoneal invasion present Gleason 7 (4+3) Bone scan showed a small spot on his pelvis PSA 55, one month later: 62 Lupron started 9-15 for 2 years Completed 6 rounds of Taxotere starting 10-1 Completed 40 rounds of Radiation and finished 3-15! DaVinci scheduled 4-19-16 Unable to remove prostate due to effects of radiation. 3 lymph nodes still had cancer PSA now undetectable!!!
Posts.Title: Provenge...

Posts.Content: My husband was just diagnosed with prostrate cancer today. He had an initial PSA OF 55 then a second one that was 61. His Gleason score is 7 (4+3). Doc is sending him to get a bone density and CT scan to see if it spread. He is 46. Needless to say, my head is spinning. Just looking for some things I should be paying attention to, like diet, therapies.... Any help? janet

Posts.Title: Just diagnosed.....

Posts.Content: They did the same therapy with my husband. Prior to his surgery, the CT scan showed lymph node involvement, so they started him on chemo right away. The side effects suck.... fatigue, diarrhea (probably the worst symptom), joint pain and for some reason, his legs really hurt him. If there is any good to come out of this, it is temporary. 6 treatments every 3 weeks. You will go bald, he lost all of his finger and toe nails towards the end, but they all grow back! It is unfortunately, and necessary evil for quality of life. Janet

Posts.Title: Just diagnosed.....

Posts.Content: Hi Ron, My husband started Chemo October 1st and he is also stage 4. They used Taxotere (6 rounds every 3 weeks) and the side effects were tolerable. Our doctors also said that new studies show adding Chemo and radiation with hormone therapy is showing great results. The side effects from the hormones will get better. He also had a lot of joint and leg pain (he also has fibromyalgia). Anyway, with the chemo, he lost his hair within the first two weeks... all of it. And he is Italian, so it was a shock. The first treatment was tolerable, but as time went on, the first week of getting the chemo, he would be down for the count. Not too much of an appetite and LOTS of diarrhea. He said it felt like fire coming out of him. The two weeks prior to chemo, he started to feel more human. With the Taxotere, he lost his sense of taste and every finger and toe nail. Now, all of these are growing back and he is able to taste again, but it was really annoying for him. One thing to keep in the back of your head... each person is different of the steroids. My husband was a BEAR when he took them (day prior, day of chemo, and day after). Just remember.... chemo is temporary. Side effects are temporary. It was difficult but a necessary evil.

Posts.Title: Moving on to the next phase of treatment

Posts.Content: Please excuse my ignorance, but what is RALP? I have seen it a few times on these boards, and know its an acronym for something, just not sure of what.
Posts.Title: Bruising

Posts.Content: Question.... We are patiently waiting to be staged. The CT revealed lymph node enlargement. We are waiting on the bone scan results. What tests do they use to stage a person? Will it be after the results of the scans or after surgery?
